Biography

2021-22 (Freshman):

Played all 25 games during her rookie season with the Braves, starting the final 17 contests with a 4.5 ppg and 1.5 rpg average…Recorded 10 assists, 6 steals and made a team-high 32 three-pointers in 17.3 mpg…Scored a season-high 13 points in Baton Rouge against LSU (12/15) in her first career start, making five field goals against the Tigers…Shot 12 three-pointers in a season-long 27-minute appearance against Alabama State (1/10)…Recorded a season-best four rebounds at Texas Southern (2/28) along with two steals, also recording three assists vs. Florida A&M (2/14).

High School:

Graduated from Kahuku High School on the north shore of Hawaii, playing point guard and shooting guard for coach Latoya Wiley…Was not able to play her senior season due to COVID-19 cancelations in Hawaii…As a junior, earned first team All-OIA and second team All-State and had the most three-pointers (40) in OIA Division I and more threes than 10 other teams in the league combined, helping her Red Raiders squad to an undefeated conference run to the 2020 OIA Championship – Claytor finishing the title game with 18 points on 5-for-10 shooting from the perimeter…Averaged 10.8 ppg and shot 75 percent from the free throw line…As a sophomore, she was named second team All-OIA and led the state in made threes, helping Kahuku to an OIA title…A-B Honor Roll member from her freshman through senior year.

Personal:

Nicknamed “Big 30”, full name is Maya H.S. Claytor…Born May 28 in Mainz, Germany and is the daughter of Mario and Liaina Claytor…Has six siblings…Enjoys playing the ukulele… Was previously teammates with Cal State Fullerton guard Lily Wahinekapu, Air Force guard Alexis “Jo” Huntimer and Florida State guard Ta'Niya Latson…Majoring in Sport Management and is interested in a coaching career.

No stats available for the current season.
